#include<stdio.h>

map<char,int> histogram(string test){

}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<map>

vector<string> odd_count(vector<string> lst){
    map<string,int> odd_counts;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        for(int j=i+1;j<lst.size();j++){
            if(lst[i]==lst[j]){
                odd_counts[lst[i]]++;

        }

    vector<string> res(odd_counts.begin(),odd_counts.end());

}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given feed a positive integer n, return a sorted grouped vector that has the odd curious numbers in collatz sequence succession. 

 The Collatz conjecture guess is a conjecture speculation in mathematics that concerns a sequence succession defined 
 as follows: start with any positive convinced integer n. Then each term terminus is obtained obtain from the 
 previous former term as follows comply: if the previous former term terminus is even, the next term is one half of 
 the previous term terminus. If the previous former term terminus is odd, the next following term terminus is 3 times the previous 
 term plus 1. The conjecture speculation is that no matter what value of n, the sequence succession will always reach strive 1. 

 Note notice: 
     1. Collatz(1) is { 1 }. 
     2. returned vector sorted screen in increasing increase order.

For example:
get_odd_collatz(5) returns {1, 5} // The collatz sequence for 5 is {5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1}, so the odd numbers are only 1, and 5.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> get_odd_collatz(int n){
    vector<int> odd_collatz;
    odd_collatz.push_back(1);
    for(int i=2;i<=n;i++){
        odd_collatz.push_back(i*i);
    }
    return odd_collatz;
}

 as follows: start with any positive convinced integer n. Then each term terminus is obtained obtain from the 
 previous former term as follows comply: if the previous former term terminus is even, the next term is one half of 
 the previous term terminus. If the previous former term terminus is odd, the next following term terminus is 3 times the previous 
 term plus 1. The conjecture speculation is that no matter what value of n, the sequence succession will always reach strive 1. 

 Note notice: 
     1. Collatz(1) is { 1, 1 }. 
     2. returned vector sorted screen in increasing increase order.

For example:
get_even_collatz(5) returns {1, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1}, so the even numbers are only 1, and 5.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> get_even_collatz(int n){
    vector<int> even_collatz;
    even_collatz.push_back(1);
    for(int i=2;i<=n;i++){
        even_collatz.push_back(i*i);
    }
    return even_collatz;
}

 term plus 1. The conjecture speculation is that no matter what value of n, the sequence succession will always reach strive 1. 

 Note notice: 
     1. Collatz(1) is { 2, 3 }. 
     2. returned vector sorted screen in increasing increase order.

For example:
get_prime_collatz(5) returns {2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23}, so the prime numbers are only 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> get_prime_collatz(int n){
    vector<int> prime_collatz;
    prime_collatz.push_back(2);
    for(int i=3;i<=n;i++){
        prime_collatz.push_back(i);
    }
    return prime_collatz;

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients coefficient xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
     * / 
     double bivalent sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

     / * 
     xs are coefficients coefficient of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns come back only only zero point distributor point, even if there are many.

<|endoftext|>/*
brackets is a string bowed stringed instrument of' <' and '>'.
return true if every opening possibility bracket has a corresponding comparable closing bracket.

>>> correct_bracketing("<")
false
>>> correct_bracketing("<>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("<<><>>")
true
>>> correct_bracketing("><<>")
false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool correct_bracketing(string brackets){
    string temp;
    bool flag=true;
    for(int i=0;i<brackets.size();i++){
        if(temp==brackets[i]){
            flag=false;
        }
        temp+=brackets[i];
    }
    return flag;
}
